name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (HSIL) and anal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN) grade II III are not normally collected by cancer registries.  AIN II III or AIN III is reportable to standard-setters (except the Commission on Cancer).  If your registry collects any of these, assign Tis.

**Note 2:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to mucosa, NOS (including intramucosal, NOS)

    Invades: 
       Lamina propria
       Muscularis mucosae
       Submucosa (superficial invasion)
       Muscularis propria (internal sphincter)

    Localized, NOS

    Ischiorectal fat/tissue
    Perianal skin
    Perirectal skin
    Rectal mucosa or submucosa
    Rectal wall
    Skeletal muscle(s):
        Anal sphincter (external)
        Levator ani
    Subcutaneous perianal tissue

**Note 3:**  Code incidental finding of malignancy in hemorrhoid according to greatest extension of tumor into wall of anus.  Assign T1 for localized, NOS if extension not specified.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4 for contiguous extension from the site of origin. Discontinuous involvement is assigned in distant metastasis.
rows:
Tumor of any size invades adjacent organ(s), 
e.g., vagina, urethra, bladder

Adjacent organs: 
    Bladder
    Broad ligament(s)
    Cervix uteri
    Corpus uteri
    Pelvic peritoneum
    Perineum
    Prostate
    Urethra
    Vagina
    Vulva

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Carcinoma in situ
Bowen disease
High grade dysplasia 
Squamous Intraepithelial Lesion (HSIL)
Anal Intraepithelial Neoplasia II-III (AIN II-III)
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm
in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
